author: zkfloof
content: they could always mine for any of the other pow chains and then convert to ETH

author: zkfloof
content: some countries may have easier access to ETH than to mining hardware thats competitive enough

author: roboteddy
content: what's the state of research on cross-L2 communication? seems like it should be theory in possible at least between turing-complete rollups (optimism, zkrollup). seems important to think about as everything moves into L2s, or else everything will be alone in a lonely L2 silo and we'll lose "interoperability by default" between projects.

author: roboteddy
content: would it be possible to build a standard protocol for trust-minimized L2<-->L2 rpc such that you only need to plug in the other L2's layer 1 address and the function you want to call? might need some kind of incentive to get someone to submit requisite L2 txs. but if we don't think about standard ways to do this, then are we going to end up with fragmentation hell?

author: roboteddy
content: on the one hand we could say this isn't Ethereum's problem; it's up to individual app developers to figure it out. and that would work to some extent, I'm sure â€” but truly it feels like a many:many problem which is best solved by some kind of coordinated protocol-level effort. now that the roadmap looks like "yay sharding so we can have more L2s", would it make sense to elevate this problem fully into eth research / roadmap land?

author: sky.cactus
content: I just saw a post by Vitalik on this somewhere...

author: roboteddy
content: absent this I have a sneaking suspicion that something like Solana (which seems to trade away some decentralization in favor of fast execution in a global namespace) could end up taking the cake. but I like this community and its ethos, so I want it to win ðŸ˜„

author: sky.cactus
content: https://notes.ethereum.org/@vbuterin/cross_rollup_trades

author: roboteddy
content: oh sweet, how timely. /me reads

author: roboteddy
content: good post by vitalik thanks for linking. extends cross-L2 transfers to L2s that don't have compute. it doesn't try to treat though the core coordination problem that seemingly will arise

author: roboteddy
content: i've been lurking ethereum ever since the original whitepaper ðŸ˜¬ this  L2<-->L2 many:many coordination problem is the first time I've been concerned about our technical priorities, hence speaking up
